group_1.textRight: *Sigh* So much for getting that boat...

group_1.textLeft: Sorry, I really screwed things up...

group_1.textRight: No...I'm sorry for intruding on you.

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry about it.
If neither of you had spoken up, I would.
And I'm not giving up just because@we don't have our boat.
Yeah...!
For now, why don't we head back to@the resort and talk some more?

group_1.textRight: Right, there's no reason to stay here.
So...you two came to look for the treasure?

group_1.textLeft: Do you know anything about it, Miyo?

group_1.textRight: No, I'm afraid I don't...

group_1.textLeft: I see... What a shame.
Hey, why don't you tell us about yourself?
Like, you know...that person you like.

group_1.textRight: Hm?!
Erm...okay.
His name is Yuta. He's from outside the@village, but we grew up together.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, so Yuta's his name.

group_1.textRight: His father is a researcher of local history@in our area.
He used to come to our village sometimes.
Yuta looked up to his dad so much that@he would tag along with him as a kid.
He knows a lot about our village's history.

group_1.textLeft: You fell for his earnestness, then.

group_1.textRight: Th-that's not...! I guess...it's good, but...!

group_1.textLeft: Does Yuta know about that village@custom, too?

group_1.textRight: Yeah...
But I'm certain he also thinks divine@retribution is just a myth.
No ship has ever sunk because@the gods willed it.

group_1.textLeft: ...But what do the villagers think?

group_1.textRight: They think I'm just some love-crazy@teenager and don't believe me...
I just want to love Yuta.
Why can't they see that...?

group_1.textCenter: A Diviner is one who makes her wish for the village...@For the sake of the Land of the Rising Sun...
I know I mustn't make a wish for@my benefit alone, but...
I simply can't bear the thought of being@unable to share my feelings with him...

group_1.textLeft: (Being in love with someone is a very@sensitive and significant thing...)
(...so making someone give it up against@their own will is wrong.)
...I want to help everyone in the village@open their eyes.
I don't want 'em to worry about being punished by@the gods, and I think the custom oughtta be changed.

group_1.textRight: But how do we go about doing that...?

group_1.textLeft: Maybe we can prove that the divine punishment@never came to pass...
Can't say how we'd go about doin' that,@though.

group_1.textRight: Why don't we go look for that ship@with the lost treasure?
Then we can determine whether it truly@did sink because of the will of the gods.

group_1.textLeft: Can we really figure that out@by investigating?

group_1.textRight: It's better than doing nothing, at least.

group_1.textLeft: ...I guess you're right.

group_1.textRight: And if we find that treasure as well,@it'll kill two birds with one stone.

group_1.textLeft: Don't tell me THAT was your plan?

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Caught me!

group_1.textLeft: I was right after all!
...Anyway, let's check out that sunken ship.
If we can find out the truth behind it@and get the custom changed,
you'll be free to fall in love.

group_1.textRight: Th...thank you...

group_1.textLeft: So how do we get out to sea, then...?
*Pant* *Pant* We finally caught up...!
